page.title: 08SAVAY FARM
page.content: Savay Farm is situated down a lane off Denham Village.Its foundations date back A.D.750 when the site was originally a church house.The foundations are made of Sarcesm Stone, the same sort of stone from which Stonehenge was made. The present day farmhouse was built in 1125 by the Derdent Family and was originally called Derdent Manor. The Derdent Family lived in the farm for 250 years. The Abbots of Westminster owned it after the Derdent Family. The Abbots let out the farm to farmers for 150 years. Then the Mortons Family rented the farm for 250 years. In the 19th century the house was bought by General Goodlake, the first man to win the Victoria Cross. The House was next owned by Sir Oswald Mosley who was an M.P. for Harrow . Sir Oswald Mosley was a fascist.
